intro: Cenolophium lapponicum, commonly known as the Lapland bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to arctic and alpine regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered in a fine, white pubescence. Cenolophium lapponicum is an important component of tundra ecosystems, contributing to biodiversity and providing nectar for pollinators.
